title: Automated Tax Collection
description: ブロックチェーン上でビジネスを構築すると、複雑な納税義務が発生します。 税金の徴収や支払いを自動化するdAPPは存在しません。

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is great and illustrates beautifully what a blockchain's purpose is designed for. 
The proposal aims to create a dApp which would be able to automatically pay a business' taxes to the state. 
Which creates the rise of 2 questions that have not been answered ideawise: 
Why not include private individual taxes as well to reach more people? 
Why not link the dApp to an exchange that pays the taxes in the currency of the state until there is enough adoption and the state is ready to accept ADA?
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers' experience is relevant to be able to build something like this. Being participants in the Plutus pioneer program is also a good indicator. 
However, today most states have implemented their own payment and tracking systems for taxation. There is not really an incentive provided as to why they would choose this one instead. 
There is also no indication of how this system would fund itsself in the long run.
f6_assessments.q2:
There isn't a lot to go by in terms of auditability. There is a plan, timeline and funding breakdown present, but not in detail. There are no outside links to find more information either. 
A proposal like this needs a risk assessment as you'd be working with enterprise financial data where security would be highly regarded.  
The proposal's quality would improve significantly is this was addressed.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a great and complex implementation that could improve adoption and usability on cardano blockchain,  beacuse Tax collection is a huge pain on all investors. The proposal articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, professional and so on.. ).
At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is only specified with implementation and not throught business case that support economic model (eg. revenues of the tax service provider, cost related to the service,…).
However the objective of the proposal is interesting, but I think it's important to improve details about the solution for the challenge (eg. with business case support).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team is completed skilled and have a very good technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a good pilot or MVP (SPOs, Community members, Plutus pioneer)
Furthermore then plan proposed is only research plan as a startup phase, so it's good as approach, but not completed with enough details.
The metrics for the assessment isn't given, so it's impossible to assess what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is poor defined.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are weakly described. The budget provided is very general and therefore I cannot say whether it is appropriate or not. There aren't more details how the budget is going to be spent, also There aren't attachment to deep dive the solution.. Futhermore there aren't basic information to asses.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea, filling in taxes is already a problem without crypto involved. This dApp would allow businesses to automate their tax payments. One thing that is a concern for me is what would you do if taxing authorities won't accept ADA as a payment? It seems like for this dApp to work that this is a big gamble to make. Since you want to make this for businesses I feel like the proposal is missing a critical part of the challenge settings and that is to attract as many users as possible to the platform. Wouldn't it have been better to start with the normal working class?
f6_assessments.q1: I have confidence that the proposers can work out this idea with the experience they have. However, there are some red flags. First off is the budget breakdown, it would've been more helpful to split up the budget into different sections. Now you just ask for a total of $25.000 which isn't really transparent. Next and final would be the gamble previously mentioned, what is the alternative if this doesn't work out. Risk analysis on this would greatly benefit the proposal. Still - with these red flags - I agree that this proposal can be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of auditability, we don't have that much to work with. The proposer did include all the necessary pointers for the proposal but most are too vague to give us specifics to work with. Some milestones would've been helpful to give a retrospective on how the proposal is developed. Also since we are working with tax authorities and this field I would've like a risk assessment since tax authorities would need these if you want them on board.

f6_assessments.q0: Not every great addition to the Cardano dApp ecosystem has to be a novel one, especially when it comes to the tax man. This is a much needed part of the decentralized application ecosystem and would be a boon to business who are, or plan to at some point utilize Cardano as a payment option for their business.
f6_assessments.q1:
I had to do a bit of digging to find the team and their project, perhaps a leave links to Twitter/GitHub account or CardanoBudz project would be very helpful and appreciated as it would lend credibility to this proposal.

In any case - The CardanoBudz website/twitter offers a look into the team and they seem talented and knowledgeable in the NFT space, which gives me reason to believe this proposal has a high likelihood of success.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap looks solid - though I would like to see a little more specifics of each KPI for the roadmap milestones. 

i.e. x,xxx number of customers onboarded day 300, 365?

Other than that, we should have enough information to measure the objective success or failure of this proposal.

solution: 私が提案する解決策は、ビジネス用の決済ゲートウェイを開発し、収益の一部を税目的で分離するというものです。
experience: 合わせて40年の経験を持つベテランのネットワークおよびサーバーエンジニア。
